cheatsheet.title: Create a new business rule analysis

intro.description:
This kind of analysis allows you to apply your Business Rules to a selected table.
Note that you can create Business Rules and assign them to the analysis created at a later stage of analysis preparation.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click either the Analyses folder on the DQ Repository tree view and select New Analysis. Expand Table Analysis and select Business Rule Analysis(or click the link below). The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description....). Browse to and select the table or view to analyze and then select the Business Rules to apply. Upon completion an editor opens, in which you can modify the metadata and review the analysis settings.

item.title: Select tables or views to analyze
item.description: Click Select Tables to analyze in the editor (or click the link below). Browse to and select the table(s) or view(s) of interest. The tables or views selected appear in the Analyzed Tables part of the editor.

item.title: Add rules to the table
item.description: To add a business rule to a table, click the Business Rule icon next to the name of the table you want to add a rule to. In the dialog box which opens, browse to and select the business rule of interest. Alternatively, drop a rule from the DQ Repository tree view on the left, next to the name of the table of interest.

item.title: Analyze.
item.description: To execute the analysis, click the Run button located to the top left of the editor (or click the link below). You can also run an analysis from the DQ Repository tree view. To do so, right click the relevant analysis and click the Run icon on the contextual menu which appears.
